newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen up at open in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen up at open in thin trade.

text.p: U.S. shares were expected to rise at the market open on Friday but trading should be light and perhaps volatile before a three-day U.S. holiday.
There were no economic data due to provide impetus to share prices and blue chip shares will watch bonds, analysts said. The bond market will shut early at 1400 EDT/1800 GMT.
"In a relatively thin market you can have wide swings in almost any group," Arnold Kaufman, editor of Standard & Poor's Outlook investment advisory news letter said.
The Standard & Poor's futures index was up 2.20 points at 842.45 while the long bond was up 7/32 at 6.97 percent.
